verses.name: Psalms 69:1
verses.text: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 69:2
verses.text: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:3
verses.text: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.

verses.name: Psalms 69:4
verses.text: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.

verses.name: Psalms 69:5
verses.text: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.

verses.name: Psalms 69:6
verses.text: Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.

verses.name: Psalms 69:7
verses.text: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.

verses.name: Psalms 69:8
verses.text: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s children.

verses.name: Psalms 69:9
verses.text: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:10
verses.text: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.

verses.name: Psalms 69:11
verses.text: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.

verses.name: Psalms 69:12
verses.text: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.

verses.name: Psalms 69:13
verses.text: But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O Lord, in an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.

verses.name: Psalms 69:14
verses.text: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

verses.name: Psalms 69:15
verses.text: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

verses.name: Psalms 69:16
verses.text: Hear me, O Lord; for thy lovingkindness is good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

verses.name: Psalms 69:17
verses.text: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.

verses.name: Psalms 69:18
verses.text: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 69:19
verses.text: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.

verses.name: Psalms 69:20
verses.text: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.

verses.name: Psalms 69:21
verses.text: They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

verses.name: Psalms 69:22
verses.text: Let their table become a snare before them: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.

verses.name: Psalms 69:23
verses.text: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.

verses.name: Psalms 69:24
verses.text: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

verses.name: Psalms 69:25
verses.text: Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their tents.

verses.name: Psalms 69:26
verses.text: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.

verses.name: Psalms 69:27
verses.text: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.

verses.name: Psalms 69:28
verses.text: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.

verses.name: Psalms 69:29
verses.text: But I am poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.

verses.name: Psalms 69:30
verses.text: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.

verses.name: Psalms 69:31
verses.text: This also shall please the Lord better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

verses.name: Psalms 69:32
verses.text: The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.

verses.name: Psalms 69:33
verses.text: For the Lord heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.

verses.name: Psalms 69:34
verses.text: Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.

verses.name: Psalms 69:35
verses.text: For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.

verses.name: Psalms 69:36
verses.text: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.
